description:
Pokémon Trainer Satoshi has a new plan: see the world! But first, he and his partner Pikachu are headed to the opening of the Sakuragi Institute, a research facility dedicated to uncovering the mysteries of Pokémon in every region. Satoshi meets Gou, another boy with boundless curiosity about Pokémon, and both are overjoyed when Professor Sakuragi asks them to become official research fellows. With Satoshi as determined as ever to become a Pokémon Master, and Gou aiming to catch one of every Pokémon (including the Mythical Mew), our heroes are in for adventure and excitement as they explore the wide world of Pokémon!

(Source: Pokémon TV)

Note: Episode 119, 121, 126 and 128 are recap episodes that did not air outside of Japan.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Rural
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the countryside.

tags.name: Proxy Battle
tags.description: A proxy battle is a battle where humans use creatures/robots to do the fighting for them, either by commanding those creatures/robots or by simply evolving them/changing them into battle mode.

tags.name: Outdoor Activities
tags.description: Centers around hiking, camping or other outdoor activities.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Delinquents
tags.description: Features characters with a notorious image and attitude, sometimes referred to as "yankees".

tags.name: Environmental
tags.description: Concern with the state of the natural world and how humans interact with it.

tags.name: Age Regression
tags.description: Prominently features a character who was returned to a younger state.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Cyberpunk
tags.description: Set in a future of advanced technological and scientific achievements that have resulted in social disorder.

tags.name: Creature Taming
tags.description: Features the taming of animals, monsters, or other creatures.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Sunma47) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/三間雅文)

One of the industry's most prolific sound directors, having worked on more than 300 productions.

After having graduated college, Mima joined Magic Capsule, a sound production company ran by his relative [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062/). In 1986, he debuted as a sound director on [MD Geist](https://anilist.co/anime/1285/MD-Geist/). He left Magic Capsule in 1996, and later joined Techno Sound. In 2004, he became the studio's representative director.

**Education:** Yoyogi Animation Academy

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/junichifujisaku)

Junichi Fujisaku is a Japanese director, animation director, scriptwriter, game producer and novelist. He's affiliated with studio Production I.G.

[Website](http://hitodama.info/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/hitodama1103/)

A Japanese singer, songwriter, radio personality and scriptwriter.

She has released 17 singles and 11 albums since her debut as a 13-year-old in 1994. Several of her songs have been used as anime theme songs. She is often mistaken for a voice actress because she is in the same field of activity as idol-esque voice actresses. When she is working as a screenwriter, she goes by the name Deko Akao, an alias made up from her senior [Satoru Akahori](https://anilist.co/staff/97460/)'s name.

Mother of a son and twin daughters.
He is a professional screenwriter for anime, drama and theater and is a member of the Writers Guild of Japan.

__Machida Touko__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sakuribo)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/吉田玲子) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reiko_Yoshida)

Yoshida has written and supervised numerous scripts for anime series, live-action dramas and films. Her major works include [Kaleido Star](https://anilist.co/anime/427), [Aria](https://anilist.co/anime/477), [Maria-sama ga Miteru](https://anilist.co/anime/158), [D.Gray-man](https://anilist.co/anime/1482), [K-On!](https://anilist.co/anime/5680), [Bakuman](https://anilist.co/anime/7674) and [Girls und Panzer](https://anilist.co/anime/14131). In more recent works, she has supervised the screenplays for [Majestic Prince](https://anilist.co/anime/15863), [Non Non Biyori](https://anilist.co/anime/17549), [A Town Where You Live](https://anilist.co/anime/17741), [Tamako Market](https://anilist.co/anime/16417), [Yowamushi Pedal](https://anilist.co/anime/18179) and [Castle Town Dandelion](https://anilist.co/anime/20951). In films, she wrote the screenplay for Ghibli's [The Cat Returns](https://anilist.co/anime/597), the original films that would make up [Digimon: The Movie](https://anilist.co/anime/2961), Kyoto Animation’s hit anime film [A Silent Voice](https://anilist.co/anime/20954), and the film adaptations of Osamu Tezuka's [Buddha](https://anilist.co/anime/7014), the last one's [second film](https://anilist.co/anime/20500) was given a stamp of approval by the Dalai Lama.

Among her works, she was recognized for Best Screenplay/Original Work for [Girls und Panzer](https://anilist.co/anime/14131) at the Tokyo Anime Award Festival in 2014, and she won another Best Screenplay/Original Work award in 2017. In 2018, she wrote the screenplay for [Violet Evergarden](https://anilist.co/anime/21827) which aired on TV in Japan and is licensed by Netflix.

Yoshida also wrote the story for the manga series [Tokyo Mew Mew](https://anilist.co/manga/30554).

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Twitter](https://x.com/kazuakimohri) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/毛利和昭)

In 1978, after graduating from Osaka Designers' College, he joined [Anime R](https://anilist.co/studio/971/). There he was a part of Studio 1, led by [Moriyasu Taniguchi](https://anilist.co/staff/106638/). At this time [Hiroyuki Okiura](https://anilist.co/staff/103502/) and [Hiroshi Ousaka](https://anilist.co/staff/107410/) were also a part of the studio. He was also one of the many animators influenced by [Yoshinori Kanada](https://anilist.co/staff/106398/), and had emerged as an outstanding action animator among the Kanada followers of the time.

He went freelance in 1989, and has since mostly done contractual work with [OLM](https://anilist.co/studio/28/).

Married to fellow animator [Mizue Ogawa](https://anilist.co/staff/134341/).

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sayuri_ichiishi)

Long-time employee at [OLM](https://anilist.co/studio/28/), and one of the studio's most respected animators.

Famous as the lead character designer for the extremely long-running [Pokémon](https://anilist.co/anime/527/) anime series. Her work faithfully resembles [Ken Sugimori](https://anilist.co/staff/107479/)'s original designs to transfer the characters into the anime. Ichiishi is also responsible for designing the majority of the original characters exclusive to the anime.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sayuri_ichiishi)

Long-time employee at [OLM](https://anilist.co/studio/28/), and one of the studio's most respected animators.

Famous as the lead character designer for the extremely long-running [Pokémon](https://anilist.co/anime/527/) anime series. Her work faithfully resembles [Ken Sugimori](https://anilist.co/staff/107479/)'s original designs to transfer the characters into the anime. Ichiishi is also responsible for designing the majority of the original characters exclusive to the anime.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/3048285252) | [Weibo](https://weibo.com/u/5223400255)

Chinese animator currently working at Toei Animation as part of the One Piece staff. Also does key animation for some other anime, mainly from the Pokémon series.
